name: BEST WESTERN Hotel de la Paix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed two nights at the De La Paix. We had a fine room, even large by French standards, and encountered an excellent member of the hotel staff at the desk, Sebastian. He was very helpful with suggestions about local events, places and nearby cities (Troyes) that might be of interest to tourists.
reviews.title: Good service

likes.liked: — Clean good-size room and reception desk assistance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located within a short walking distance from the Cathedral, and a lunch at Troyes was delightful, including a friendly restauranteur. There are several cafes just around the corner from the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Bad Manners...

reviews.text: If in Reims, I recommend that you consider the De La Paix.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.liked: — large rooms, very modern, great views

reviews.text: We stayed at the BW Hotel de la Paix for two nights during our honeymoon stay and while it is a gorgeous hotel, with modern, ample rooms, the hotel staff makes your stay less than enjoyable. Upon arrival, we were greeted in the garage by a member of the staff and as he watched my husband and I struggle to get the luggage out of our car, he did not even offer to help, but actually acted annoyed at the fact that we were taking too long. Arriving at the check in desk, I am greeted with "So I guess you want to check in?"...excuse me?
reviews.title: Great hotel, don't understand why it doesn't have 4 stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, if you are on a business trip and want to enjoy the champagne bar when you come home, this is the perfect, comfortable hotel for you....if you want attention to details, a courteous welcome and a petit chateau feel, this is not the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

likes.disliked: — breakfast not inluded in the rate - it wouln't kill them to provide breakfast

reviews.text: A very good hotel in a superb location in Reims. Nicely decorated, very modern bedrooms and bathrooms which I couldn't fault. The parking which we had reserved is underground and can't take vehicles with top boxes on. It is obviously a common problem and they said people normally remove their top boxes and put them in the left luggage room - NOT an option for us. It was packed. The staff on front desk ummed and ahhed, suggesting we pay for street parking and move the car every two hours until 7pm. This would not have been a very relaxing break! A manger appeared and was far more helpful than his staff. He suggested a good outdoor car park in front of the police station just a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel had a cute little pool leading onto a courtyard where you can sunbathe, weather permitting - luckily for us it was 28 degrees. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful location
Excellent for a stop-over
reviews.text: Excellent location, helpful staff, great underground parking, a nice modern hotel. Room 626 was a good size, looked newly refurbished and was at the rear (quiet side) of the hotel. Good value at about GB£85 for the room, albeit plus breakfast and parking. Pitty they feel the need to charge for WiFi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, great modern decor, friendly staff in perfect central location. Facilities feel like 4*.
reviews.title: Superb 3 star hotel
pretty good for a short stop but some problems
reviews.text: NB We didnt use hotel restaurant given wide choice of local cafes / restaurants for breakfast and dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: helpful staff, ok room and good location and underground parking
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful from the reception and bar to the outdoor courtyard. The room was tastefully decorated and clean. The on-suite was luxurious and we stayed for 2 nights whilst travelling in France. The staff were helpful and spoke good English (as our french wasn't very good).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, lovely place to visit

likes.liked: — The modern building and luxurious furnishings
likes.disliked: — Car park was full - need to book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is round the corner from a street full of restaurants where you can sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere. Great for acces to trains and a bustling town setting.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: They do have parking available under the hotel, but this was all booked up when we arrived so we parked in the multistorey car park opposite the hotel which was a slight annoyance as we had to carry the bags across so I would recommend phoning and booking the car park before your arrival.
reviews.title: Nice courtyard

reviews.text: The nicest hotel I have stayed in!! I can't wait to go again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in centre of town

reviews.text: This was a great city centre hotel. It was very modern, very well designed with a real boutique-hotel feel - some nice designer touches! Although on quite a busy street, it was very quiet and the parking area below the hotel was quite spacious and seemed very secure. Staff were very polite and helpful and despite my best attempts in French, were able to reply in English! The hotel is very well placed and quite easy to find - study the map first - and easy to get back to the motorway. There are loads of restaurants nearby (we liked L'apostrophe - good food at reasonable prices) but you are spoilt for choice here. I would certainly stay here again - full marks!
reviews.title: Extremely helpful staff

likes.disliked: — The size of hte wardrobe space

reviews.title: Hotel photo
reviews.text: My son & I stayed in this hotel & there are 2 things I would like to point out, 1st dont be deceived by the photo of the hotel, this is not a front view so we had a job finding it due to this, just look for the sign Best Western cant miss it. 2nd to get to the 1st floor from the reception this is gained by either an elevator or stairs, the lift to the rooms are on this level, but from the 1st floor to reception this is only gained by stairs only, not good if you have a lot of luggage or elderly, cant understand why, but apart from that this is very nice hotel, very clean & beds comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For 130 Euro a night, my wife and I just stayed at this Best Western hotel in the center of the shopping and restaurants of Reims. The hotel has easily accessed secure on-site underground parking for just 10 Euro a night, and a very trendy champagne bar. The finish inside is modern and clean, and contrasted very nicely with the very old 4 story tall chapel that is part of the hotel.
reviews.title: 4 star hotel at 3 star pricing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fantastic. We were in a privilege level room and it had a comfortable Queen bed, a very nice bathroom with separate shower and tub, and a flat screen television. The mini-bar was clean and glass fronted, and of course had a bottle of Champagne inside. The light switches were controlled easily from the bedside, and the air conditioning worked well. The shower even had a rainshower head and they replenished the pleasant toiletries (a Parisian labeled brand I hadn't heard of) daily! Everything in the room was in good working condition.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.text: We lucked into a room on the top floor facing into the courtyard. This gave us a balcony with two comfortable chairs, a great view of the ancient chapel that is part of the hotel now (its been cleaned up and remodeled slightly I believe) and even a view of the Reims cathedral.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good but not excellent at the front desk - they were fairly busy. We didn't eat any meals in the hotel, but the hotel restaurant looked better than your average hotel restaurant by a long-shot. It seemed to be a place in its own right.
reviews.title: Smart, modern, comfortable

likes.liked: — The room and the check-in staff
likes.disliked: — Breakfast was adequate rather than outstanding

description: The BEST WESTERN Hotel de la Paix is located in the heart of Reims, in an exceptional setting. A stone’s throw away from the cathedral, our hotel is also situated near the conventioncentre and the highspeed train station.The hotel, which combines modernity and cultural heritage, has 165 comfortable, soundproof and air-conditioned rooms with free wifi.
